segments.en: Hello, English learners.
segments.cn: 你好，英语学习者。

segments.en: Welcome back to EnglishPod.
segments.cn: 欢迎回到EnglishPod。

segments.en: My name is Marco.
segments.cn: 我叫Marco。

segments.en: And my name is Erica.
segments.cn: 我叫Erica。

segments.en: Today we're bringing you another one of our sports lessons, and this time we're going to go to a boxing match.
segments.cn: 今天我们为你带来另一节体育课，这次我们将去看一场拳击比赛。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So we're going to be learning a language that you can use if you're talking about boxing.
segments.cn: 所以我们将学习一些可以用来谈论拳击的语言。

segments.en: But not only boxing, right?
segments.cn: 但不仅仅是拳击，对吧？

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: We can also use this language for describing a fight or somebody that's fighting.
segments.cn: 我们也可以用这些语言来描述一场打斗或正在打斗的人。

segments.en: Okay, so not that we're asking our listeners to get into fights, but if ever you see a fight, at least now you'll have the language to talk about it.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们并不是让听众去打架，但如果你看到打斗，至少现在你有语言来谈论它。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: So let's listen to our dialogue for the first time.
segments.cn: 那么让我们第一次听听对话。

segments.en: It might sound familiar, we have the legendary Rocky Balboa at EnglishPod fighting for the heavyweight championship.
segments.cn: 这可能听起来很熟悉，我们有传奇的洛基·巴尔博亚在EnglishPod为重量级冠军而战。

segments.en: So let's see what happens.
segments.cn: 那么让我们看看会发生什么。

segments.en: Welcome back boxing fans.
segments.cn: 欢迎回来，拳击迷们。

segments.en: My name is Rick Fields, and here with me is the man with the iron jaw, Bob Copeland.
segments.cn: 我叫Rick Fields，和我在一起的是铁下巴的男人，Bob Copeland。

segments.en: Thank you, Rick.
segments.cn: 谢谢你，Rick。

segments.en: We're coming to you live from Las Vegas.
segments.cn: 我们正在拉斯维加斯现场直播。

segments.en: We're in the beautiful MGM Grand Hotel and Casino, where the World Heavyweight Championship is about to get underway.
segments.cn: 我们在美丽的MGM大酒店和赌场，世界重量级冠军赛即将开始。

segments.en: That's right, Bob.
segments.cn: 没错，Bob。

segments.en: We're about to witness the legendary Italian Stallion himself, Rocky Balboa, square off against his lifetime rival, Apollo Creed.
segments.cn: 我们即将见证传奇的意大利骏马洛基·巴尔博亚与他一生的对手阿波罗·克里德的对决。

segments.en: This will be a gruesome match for sure.
segments.cn: 这肯定是一场惨烈的比赛。

segments.en: Both fighters are in the ring, and we are about to begin.
segments.cn: 两位拳手都在擂台上，我们即将开始。

segments.en: In the blue corner, weighing in at 220 pounds, the former heavyweight champion of the world, the master of disaster, the one and only Apollo Creed.
segments.cn: 在蓝色角落，体重220磅，前世界重量级冠军，灾难大师，唯一的阿波罗·克里德。

segments.en: In the red corner, weighing 218 pounds, and with a record of 47 wins and 37 knockouts, the undefeated, undisputed heavyweight champion of the world, the Italian Stallion, Rocky Balboa.
segments.cn: 在红色角落，体重218磅，战绩47胜37次击倒，未被击败的世界重量级冠军，意大利骏马洛基·巴尔博亚。

segments.en: There's the bell, and this fight is underway.
segments.cn: 响铃了，这场比赛开始了。

segments.en: Apollo quickly attacks Rocky with quick, strong jabs.
segments.cn: 阿波罗迅速用快速有力的刺拳攻击洛基。

segments.en: Rocky dodges successfully and counterattacks with a strong right hook.
segments.cn: 洛基成功躲避并用强有力的右钩反击。

segments.en: Apollo is cut.
segments.cn: 阿波罗受伤了。

segments.en: Rocky landed a strong blow to his right eyebrow and cut him.
segments.cn: 洛基重重击中了他的右眉头，割伤了他。

segments.en: This is his chance.
segments.cn: 这是他的机会。

segments.en: Rocky quickly throws a left, right, and other left.
segments.cn: 洛基迅速出拳，左、右、再左。

segments.en: Apollo is getting pounded.
segments.cn: 阿波罗被打得很惨。

segments.en: Apollo recovers with a powerful haymaker and catches Rocky off guard.
segments.cn: 阿波罗恢复了，发出强有力的重拳，出其不意地击倒了洛基。

segments.en: He's down.
segments.cn: 他倒下了。

segments.en: The ref starts the count.
segments.cn: 裁判开始计数。

segments.en: One, two, three, four.
segments.cn: 一，二，三，四。

segments.en: Wow, sounds like a great fight.
segments.cn: 哇，听起来是一场精彩的比赛。

segments.en: Amazing fight, and I don't know who's going to win.
segments.cn: 惊人的比赛，我不知道谁会赢。

segments.en: Rocky apparently got knocked down.
segments.cn: 洛基显然被击倒了。

segments.en: What do you think will happen?
segments.cn: 你认为会发生什么？

segments.en: Well, if I know anything about Rocky Balboa, he will not stay knocked down for long.
segments.cn: 嗯，如果我对洛基·巴尔博亚了解一点，他不会长时间被击倒。

segments.en: All right, so let's take a look at some of the language we saw in this dialogue in Language Takeaway.
segments.cn: 好吧，让我们看看在这段对话中我们看到的一些语言在语言收获中。

segments.en: Well, Rick Field said that we have a very gruesome match tonight.
segments.cn: 好吧，Rick Field说今晚我们有一场非常惨烈的比赛。

segments.en: A gruesome match.
segments.cn: 一场惨烈的比赛。

segments.en: Gruesome.
segments.cn: 惨烈。

segments.en: All right, so if something is gruesome... It's really, it's bad, it's terrible, it's bloody.
segments.cn: 好吧，如果某事是惨烈的……它真的很糟糕，很可怕，很血腥。

segments.en: Okay, bloody, terrible, very hard, or like a gruesome fight would be a very bloody fight.
segments.cn: 好吧，血腥、可怕、非常激烈，或者像一场惨烈的打斗将是非常血腥的打斗。

segments.en: Yeah, or a gruesome film.
segments.cn: 是的，或者一部惨烈的电影。

segments.en: Okay, very good.
segments.cn: 好吧，非常好。

segments.en: So gruesome.
segments.cn: 所以惨烈。

segments.en: Now, they mention that both fighters are in the ring.
segments.cn: 现在，他们提到两位拳手都在擂台上。

segments.en: Both fighters are in the ring.
segments.cn: 两位拳手都在擂台上。

segments.en: The ring.
segments.cn: 擂台。

segments.en: Okay, so the ring is the physical space where they fight.
segments.cn: 好吧，擂台是他们打斗的物理空间。

segments.en: But isn't it square?
segments.cn: 但它不是方形的吗？

segments.en: Yeah, it is square.
segments.cn: 是的，它是方形的。

segments.en: It's not really circular, but it's called a boxing ring.
segments.cn: 它并不是真正的圆形，但它被称为拳击擂台。

segments.en: I'm not really sure why.
segments.cn: 我不太确定为什么。

segments.en: Well, maybe one of our listeners knows and can tell us about that, because I am not an expert on boxing.
segments.cn: 嗯，也许我们的听众中的某个人知道并可以告诉我们，因为我不是拳击专家。

segments.en: But what I do know is our next word.
segments.cn: 但我知道我们的下一个词。

segments.en: They were describing Rocky Balboa's career, and they said he had 37 knockouts.
segments.cn: 他们在描述洛基·巴尔博亚的职业生涯时说他有37次击倒。

segments.en: Okay, a knockout.
segments.cn: 好吧，击倒。

segments.en: A knockout.
segments.cn: 击倒。

segments.en: In this sense, knockout is a noun.
segments.cn: 在这个意义上，击倒是一个名词。

segments.en: A knockout is when the fighter hits the other fighter, and he falls to the ground, and he can't get up in 10 seconds, because he's tired, he's dizzy, he's hurt.
segments.cn: 击倒是当拳手击中另一个拳手，他倒在地上，10秒内无法站起来，因为他累了、头晕、受伤。

segments.en: Okay, so... So that's a knockout.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以……这就是击倒。

segments.en: Okay, so this is a technical boxing word.
segments.cn: 好吧，这是一种技术性的拳击词。

segments.en: It's the action of falling to the ground and not getting up.
segments.cn: 这是倒在地上而不再站起来的动作。

segments.en: Right, but there's also a verb, to knock out.
segments.cn: 对，但还有一个动词，击倒。

segments.en: Or to knock someone out.
segments.cn: 或者击倒某人。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: So when you say, I knocked this guy out...
segments.cn: 所以当你说，我击倒了这个家伙……

segments.en: It means I hit him so hard that he fell to the floor, and maybe he was unconscious for a while.
segments.cn: 这意味着我打得很重，他倒在地上，可能他失去意识了一段时间。

segments.en: So he fell asleep, basically.
segments.cn: 所以他基本上是睡着了。

segments.en: Almost.
segments.cn: 几乎是。

segments.en: So it's very similar, the noun form to the verb form.
segments.cn: 所以名词形式和动词形式非常相似。

segments.en: Basically, if you knock someone out, you get a knockout.
segments.cn: 基本上，如果你击倒某人，你就得到了一个击倒。

segments.en: Okay, so to knock someone out, a knockout.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以击倒某人，一个击倒。

segments.en: Alright, now for our next word, we saw as Apollo quickly began to jab Rocky Balboa.
segments.cn: 好吧，现在我们的下一个词，我们看到阿波罗迅速开始刺拳洛基·巴尔博亚。

segments.en: So the noun, a jab.
segments.cn: 所以名词，一个刺拳。

segments.en: So a jab, quick jabs.
segments.cn: 所以一个刺拳，快速的刺拳。

segments.en: So a jab is a kind of punch, right?
segments.cn: 所以刺拳是一种拳击，对吧？

segments.en: It's a fast, short, but not very strong punch.
segments.cn: 它是快速、短小，但不是很有力的拳。

segments.en: Okay, so a technical boxing word, a jab.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以这是一个技术性的拳击词，刺拳。

segments.en: A jab.
segments.cn: 刺拳。

segments.en: This can also be a verb, right?
segments.cn: 这也可以是一个动词，对吧？

segments.en: Right, so to jab.
segments.cn: 对，所以刺拳。

segments.en: To jab.
segments.cn: 刺拳。

segments.en: Now, Apollo was throwing jabs, and Rocky began to dodge.
segments.cn: 现在，阿波罗在出刺拳，而洛基开始躲避。

segments.en: Alright, and that's our next word, to dodge.
segments.cn: 好吧，这就是我们的下一个词，躲避。

segments.en: Dodge.
segments.cn: 躲避。

segments.en: D -O-D-G-E, to dodge.
segments.cn: D -O-D-G-E，躲避。

segments.en: Alright, so if you dodge, you're trying to avoid getting hit.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以如果你躲避，你是在试图避免被击中。

segments.en: Right, so you move your body so that you're not hit.
segments.cn: 对，所以你移动你的身体，以免被击中。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: Now, we can also use it in different ways.
segments.cn: 现在，我们也可以用不同的方式使用它。

segments.en: Not only do you dodge when somebody's trying to punch you, you can also, for example, dodge a bullet.
segments.cn: 不仅仅是当有人试图打你时你躲避，你也可以，例如，躲避子弹。

segments.en: Right, so when you dodge a bullet, you avoid some bad situation or some bad event.
segments.cn: 对，所以当你躲避子弹时，你避免了一些糟糕的情况或事件。

segments.en: Right, so we have many examples of dodge used in other contexts, so why don't we listen to some examples?
segments.cn: 对，我们有很多躲避在其他语境中使用的例子，为什么不听听一些例子呢？

segments.en: Example one.
segments.cn: 例子一。

segments.en: See that guy dodging through the traffic?
segments.cn: 看到那个家伙在交通中躲避吗？

segments.en: He's going to get hit by a car if he's not careful.
segments.cn: 如果他不小心，他会被车撞到。

segments.en: Example two.
segments.cn: 例子二。

segments.en: Well, the storm turned south, so it looks like we managed to dodge a bullet.
segments.cn: 嗯，暴风雨向南转了，所以看起来我们成功躲过了一劫。

segments.en: Example three.
segments.cn: 例子三。

segments.en: Look, you're the one who is in charge of sales, and the numbers are down.
segments.cn: 看，你是负责销售的，数字下滑了。

segments.en: It's your problem, so stop trying to dodge your responsibilities.
segments.cn: 这是你的问题，所以别再试图逃避责任了。

segments.en: You know, that word reminds me of another sport, dodgeball.
segments.cn: 你知道，这个词让我想起了另一项运动，躲避球。

segments.en: Oh, dodgeball, exactly.
segments.cn: 哦，躲避球，正是如此。

segments.en: Same principle.
segments.cn: 同样的原则。

segments.en: Yeah, but that's an entirely different lesson.
segments.cn: 是的，但那是完全不同的课程。

segments.en: I think we need to focus here on the boxing vocabulary.
segments.cn: 我认为我们需要专注于拳击词汇。

segments.en: So the announcers said that Apollo is getting pounded.
segments.cn: 所以播报员说阿波罗正在被猛击。

segments.en: To get pounded.
segments.cn: 被猛击。

segments.en: To get pounded.
segments.cn: 被猛击。

segments.en: Now, if someone is getting pounded... They're getting hit really hard.
segments.cn: 现在，如果有人被猛击……他们被狠狠地击中。

segments.en: And a lot.
segments.cn: 而且很多次。

segments.en: So, to get pounded.
segments.cn: 所以，被猛击。

segments.en: To get pounded.
segments.cn: 被猛击。

segments.en: And now we have one more word, and it's also another boxing term called a haymaker.
segments.cn: 现在我们还有一个词，也是另一个拳击术语，叫做重拳。

segments.en: A powerful haymaker.
segments.cn: 一记强有力的重拳。

segments.en: Okay, so Apollo received a powerful haymaker.
segments.cn: 好的，所以阿波罗遭到了强有力的重拳。

segments.en: Now, this word is actually new to me, so Marco, what does it mean?
segments.cn: 现在，这个词对我来说其实是新的，马尔科，这是什么意思？

segments.en: Basically, it's a very strong, very wild punch.
segments.cn: 基本上，这是一个非常强烈、非常狂野的拳。

segments.en: Okay, so you don't have really good form.
segments.cn: 好的，所以你的姿势并不好。

segments.en: Your body is kind of moving all over the place.
segments.cn: 你的身体有点四处乱动。

segments.en: Right, so you don't have much balance.
segments.cn: 对，所以你没有太多的平衡。

segments.en: So you just throw your entire body and your fist at someone to hit them as hard as you can.
segments.cn: 所以你只是把整个身体和拳头扔向某人，尽可能用力地击打他们。

segments.en: That's a haymaker.
segments.cn: 这就是重拳。

segments.en: Alright, a technical boxing word here for you guys.
segments.cn: 好吧，这里有一个技术性的拳击词汇给你们。

segments.en: But now we've got some interesting phrases for you on Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 但现在我们有一些有趣的短语给你们在流利度提升中。

segments.en: Fluency Builder Alright, so on Fluency Builder today we're going to take a look at some of these phrases and we have four of them for you today, so let's get started with the first one.
segments.cn: 流利度提升 好的，所以今天在流利度提升中，我们将看看这些短语，今天有四个短语给你们，所以让我们开始第一个。

segments.en: Well, the announcer said that the boxing match was about to get underway.
segments.cn: 嗯，播报员说拳击比赛即将开始。

segments.en: Okay, to get underway.
segments.cn: 好的，开始。

segments.en: To get underway.
segments.cn: 开始。

segments.en: So, again, this is another way of saying about to begin.
segments.cn: 所以，这又是另一种说即将开始的方式。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: Alright, so we're about to get underway with this new project.
segments.cn: 好的，所以我们即将开始这个新项目。

segments.en: Or the meeting's just about to get underway, so make sure everyone's here.
segments.cn: 或者会议即将开始，所以确保每个人都在。

segments.en: Very good.
segments.cn: 非常好。

segments.en: So the match was about to get underway and the sports announcer said that Rocky Balboa is going to square off against his lifetime rival.
segments.cn: 所以比赛即将开始，体育播报员说洛基·巴尔博亚将与他的终身对手对峙。

segments.en: So we're going to look at this phrase to square off against someone.
segments.cn: 所以我们将看看这个短语与某人对峙。

segments.en: Alright, I'm going to square off against Jim.
segments.cn: 好的，我将与吉姆对峙。

segments.en: Alright, when you square off against Jim you get ready to fight with him or to compete with him, right?
segments.cn: 好的，当你与吉姆对峙时，你准备与他打架或竞争，对吧？

segments.en: Right, so we're about to have a one-to-one competition.
segments.cn: 对，所以我们即将进行一对一的竞争。

segments.en: So this is like a sports word, but it's also really commonly used in a lot of different contexts.
segments.cn: 这就像是一个体育词汇，但在很多不同的语境中也很常用。

segments.en: So why don't we hear a few more examples of how we can use this phrase to square off.
segments.cn: 所以为什么不听听更多关于如何使用这个短语与某人对峙的例子呢。

segments.en: Example one.
segments.cn: 例子一。

segments.en: The two countries are moving their armies close to the borders as they prepare to square off in a border dispute.
segments.cn: 两国正在将军队移近边界，准备在边界争端中对峙。

segments.en: Example two.
segments.cn: 例子二。

segments.en: Italy and Brazil are squaring off in the final game this afternoon.
segments.cn: 意大利和巴西今天下午将在决赛中对峙。

segments.en: Example three.
segments.cn: 例子三。

segments.en: Lisa and Daniel squared off against each other in the marketing meeting today.
segments.cn: 莉莎和丹尼尔今天在市场会议上对峙。

segments.en: They were both pretty angry.
segments.cn: 他们都很生气。

segments.en: Alright, so great examples and I think we can use it now not only in boxing but in other situations.
segments.cn: 好吧，很好的例子，我认为我们现在不仅可以在拳击中使用它，还可以在其他情况下使用。

segments.en: Now Bob said that Rocky landed a strong blow.
segments.cn: 现在鲍勃说洛基打出了一记强有力的击打。

segments.en: To land a strong blow.
segments.cn: 打出强有力的击打。

segments.en: Alright, so land a strong blow.
segments.cn: 好的，所以打出强有力的击打。

segments.en: Now let's break this down.
segments.cn: 现在让我们分解一下。

segments.en: So a blow.
segments.cn: 所以一击。

segments.en: A blow is a punch or a hit.
segments.cn: 一击是拳头或击打。

segments.en: Okay, and when you land a strong blow, what happens?
segments.cn: 好的，当你打出强有力的击打时，会发生什么？

segments.en: You basically successfully hit your opponent with a punch or hit.
segments.cn: 你基本上成功地用拳头击中了对手。

segments.en: So you hit them, so your fist meets their body.
segments.cn: 所以你击中了他们，你的拳头碰到了他们的身体。

segments.en: Yes, so your fist landed on their body.
segments.cn: 是的，所以你的拳头落在了他们的身体上。

segments.en: So I could also change this a little bit.
segments.cn: 所以我也可以稍微改变一下。

segments.en: I could say, I landed a punch.
segments.cn: 我可以说，我打出了一记拳。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: Or in boxing terms, he landed a strong left jab.
segments.cn: 或者用拳击术语来说，他打出了一记强有力的左勾拳。

segments.en: Okay, so to land a blow.
segments.cn: 好的，所以打出一击。

segments.en: The announcer described it as Rocky threw a left.
segments.cn: 播报员形容洛基出了一记左拳。

segments.en: To throw a left.
segments.cn: 出一记左拳。

segments.en: So he said he threw a left and a right.
segments.cn: 所以他说他出了一记左拳和右拳。

segments.en: Now again, we'll take this one apart.
segments.cn: 现在我们再来拆解一下。

segments.en: So a left.
segments.cn: 所以一记左拳。

segments.en: What are we talking about?
segments.cn: 我们在谈论什么？

segments.en: Basically a left punch.
segments.cn: 基本上是一记左拳。

segments.en: But we can omit punch.
segments.cn: 但我们可以省略拳。

segments.en: Okay, so it's a punch with your left hand.
segments.cn: 好的，所以这是用左手出的一记拳。

segments.en: But the verb throw.
segments.cn: 但动词出。

segments.en: You throw a left punch.
segments.cn: 你出一记左拳。

segments.en: So basically you punch somebody with your left.
segments.cn: 所以基本上你用左手打某人。

segments.en: Okay, so it's just another way of saying to punch someone.
segments.cn: 好的，所以这只是另一种说法，表示打某人。

segments.en: Right, so Bob started to throw some punches at the other guy.
segments.cn: 对，所以鲍勃开始向另一个家伙出拳。

segments.en: Alright, or look over there, that guy's throwing punches.
segments.cn: 好吧，或者看看那边，那个家伙在出拳。

segments.en: Alright, so to throw a left, to throw a punch.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以出一记左拳，出一记拳。

segments.en: Now again, you can use this in a lot of different ways with a lot of different types of punches.
segments.cn: 现在再次，你可以用很多不同的方式和不同类型的拳来使用这个。

segments.en: So you could say to throw a jab.
segments.cn: 所以你可以说出一记勾拳。

segments.en: Okay, or throw an uppercut.
segments.cn: 好的，或者出一记上勾拳。

segments.en: Or throw a hook.
segments.cn: 或者出一记钩拳。

segments.en: Okay, so now that we've seen all these phrases, why don't we listen to the dialogue for the very last time.
segments.cn: 好的，所以现在我们已经看过所有这些短语，为什么不最后一次听听对话呢。

segments.en: And we'll come back in a little bit.
segments.cn: 然后我们稍后再回来。

segments.en: Bob against his lifetime rival, Apollo Creed.
segments.cn: 鲍勃对阵他的终身对手阿波罗·克里德。

segments.en: This will be a gruesome match for sure.
segments.cn: 这肯定是一场惨烈的比赛。

segments.en: Both fighters are in the ring.
segments.cn: 两位拳手已经在擂台上。

segments.en: And we are about to begin.
segments.cn: 我们即将开始。

segments.en: In the blue corner.
segments.cn: 在蓝色角落。

segments.en: Weighing in at 220 pounds.
segments.cn: 体重220磅。

segments.en: The former heavyweight champion of the world.
segments.cn: 前世界重量级冠军。

segments.en: The master of disaster.
segments.cn: 灾难之主。

segments.en: The one and only Apollo Creed.
segments.cn: 唯一的阿波罗·克里德。

segments.en: In the red corner.
segments.cn: 在红色角落。

segments.en: Weighing 218 pounds.
segments.cn: 体重218磅。

segments.en: And with a record of 47 wins and 37 knockouts.
segments.cn: 战绩47胜37次击倒。

segments.en: The undefeated, undisputed heavyweight champion of the world.
segments.cn: 不败的、无可争议的世界重量级冠军。

segments.en: The Italian Stallion, Rocky Balboa.
segments.cn: 意大利骏马，洛基·巴尔博亚。

segments.en: There's the bell.
segments.cn: 响铃了。

segments.en: And this fight is underway.
segments.cn: 比赛开始了。

segments.en: Apollo quickly attacks Rocky with quick strong jabs.
segments.cn: 阿波罗迅速用强有力的刺拳攻击洛基。

segments.en: Rocky dodges successfully and counter attacks with a strong right hook.
segments.cn: 洛基成功躲避并用强有力的右钩拳反击。

segments.en: Apollo is cut.
segments.cn: 阿波罗受伤了。

segments.en: Rocky landed a strong blow to his right eyebrow and cut him.
segments.cn: 洛基重重击中了他的右眉头，割伤了他。

segments.en: This is his chance.
segments.cn: 这是他的机会。

segments.en: Rocky quickly throws a left.
segments.cn: 洛基迅速出左拳。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 右拳。

segments.en: Another left.
segments.cn: 另一个左拳。

segments.en: Apollo is getting pounded.
segments.cn: 阿波罗被打得很惨。

segments.en: Apollo recovers with a powerful haymaker.
segments.cn: 阿波罗用一记强力的重拳恢复过来。

segments.en: And catches Rocky off guard.
segments.cn: 并让洛基措手不及。

segments.en: He's down.
segments.cn: 他倒下了。

segments.en: The ref starts the count.
segments.cn: 裁判开始计数。

segments.en: One.
segments.cn: 一。

segments.en: Two.
segments.cn: 二。

segments.en: Three.
segments.cn: 三。

segments.en: Four.
segments.cn: 四。

segments.en: So as I mentioned Marco, I'm not really that much of a fan or that knowledgeable about boxing.
segments.cn: 正如我提到的，马尔科，我对拳击并不是特别感兴趣或了解。

segments.en: And actually this is becoming a theme in any sports lesson, isn't it?
segments.cn: 其实这在任何体育课上都成了一个主题，不是吗？

segments.en: Well, boxing is a very popular sport in North America.
segments.cn: 嗯，拳击在北美是一项非常受欢迎的运动。

segments.en: I'm not really that big of a fan.
segments.cn: 我并不是特别喜欢。

segments.en: But I have seen a couple of matches and it's very interesting because as we saw in our dialogue, most big fights take place in Las Vegas at some big hotel.
segments.cn: 但我看过几场比赛，这很有趣，因为正如我们在对话中看到的，大多数重要的比赛都在拉斯维加斯的一些大酒店举行。

segments.en: Right, but you said it's super popular and everyone wants to watch these matches.
segments.cn: 对，但你说它超级受欢迎，大家都想看这些比赛。

segments.en: And obviously everyone can't go to Las Vegas.
segments.cn: 显然，大家不能都去拉斯维加斯。

segments.en: So what's the common way for most people to watch these boxing matches?
segments.cn: 那大多数人看拳击比赛的常见方式是什么？

segments.en: Right, so in the United States there's something very popular called Pay Per View.
segments.cn: 对，所以在美国有一种非常流行的叫做按次付费。

segments.en: And I'm sure in your countries you have something similar.
segments.cn: 我相信在你们的国家也有类似的东西。

segments.en: Basically Pay Per View you can buy the fight so you can have access to it and watch it on your TV.
segments.cn: 基本上，按次付费你可以购买比赛，这样你就可以在电视上观看。

segments.en: But you only pay one time to watch like maybe two hours, right?
segments.cn: 但你只需支付一次，观看大约两个小时，对吧？

segments.en: Right, so let's say you're at your house, it's six o'clock and the fight begins at eight.
segments.cn: 对，所以假设你在家，六点钟，比赛在八点开始。

segments.en: So you can call your TV cable company or maybe use on the Internet with a credit card.
segments.cn: 你可以打电话给你的有线电视公司，或者在网上用信用卡。

segments.en: And they activate it on your TV so you can watch the fight.
segments.cn: 他们会在你的电视上激活它，这样你就可以观看比赛。

segments.en: And when it's over, well, you've finished watching it.
segments.cn: 比赛结束后，你就看完了。

segments.en: Now it's pretty expensive, isn't it?
segments.cn: 现在这很贵，对吧？

segments.en: Yeah, Pay Per View can be very expensive depending on what event it is.
segments.cn: 是的，按次付费可能非常昂贵，具体取决于是什么活动。

segments.en: Because sometimes it's boxing matches, concerts, or special events.
segments.cn: 因为有时是拳击比赛、音乐会或特别活动。

segments.en: So it can maybe cost, I don't know, $60, $80, maybe $100.
segments.cn: 所以可能会花费，我不知道，60美元、80美元，甚至100美元。

segments.en: So it's very popular for one house to buy the Pay Per View.
segments.cn: 所以一个家庭购买按次付费是非常普遍的。

segments.en: And then many friends come over and everyone chips in with $5 or $10 and everyone watches it on one TV.
segments.cn: 然后很多朋友过来，每个人出5美元或10美元，大家一起在一台电视上观看。

segments.en: Alright, so the Pay Per View Boxing Party, a common way to watch the sport in America.
segments.cn: 好吧，按次付费拳击派对，在美国观看这项运动的常见方式。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: Now why don't you guys visit our website and tell us about boxing.
segments.cn: 现在你们为什么不访问我们的网站，告诉我们关于拳击的事呢？

segments.en: Do you guys like it?
segments.cn: 你们喜欢吗？

segments.en: Do you know anything about it?
segments.cn: 你们知道些什么吗？

segments.en: Are you guys maybe even boxers yourselves?
segments.cn: 你们自己是拳击手吗？

segments.en: Or former boxers.
segments.cn: 或者是前拳击手。

segments.en: Alright, so we'll see you guys at our website.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们在网站上见。

segments.en: And also if you have any questions or comments, be sure to leave them there as well.
segments.cn: 如果你们有任何问题或评论，也请务必在那里留言。

segments.en: You can find us at EnglishPod.com.
segments.cn: 你们可以在EnglishPod.com找到我们。

segments.en: And until next time, thanks for listening and goodbye.
segments.cn: 下次再见，感谢收听，再见。
